intro: Euchylia villosa, commonly known as the hairy billygoat weed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is an invasive species in some regions, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Euchylia villosa is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions, making it a persistent weed in agricultural and natural areas.
